message.content:
Below is one worked‐through solution matching the photograph exactly (no re‐orientations required).  I have broken it into three parts:

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
1)  ANALYSIS OF THE TARGET STRUCTURE
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
•  Total Blocks & Layers  
   – The model uses 8 total blocks arranged in four layers:  
     1) Bottom Layer: Two red arches (left and right).  
     2) Second Layer: Three red blocks in a row (a tall red arch in the center flanked by two rectangular red blocks).  
     3) Third Layer: One long yellow rectangular block bridging across the three red blocks below.  
     4) Top Layer: Two orange‐red wedge (roof) pieces meeting at a peak.

•  Spatial Relationships  
   – The two bottom red arches sit side‐by‐side with a gap in the middle.  
   – Above them, the tall center arch is directly over the gap, with one rectangular red block on each side to make a solid row of three.  
   – A single yellow rectangular “beam” spans left‐to‐right on top of that row.  
   – Finally, two wedge‐shaped roof pieces sit on the yellow beam, forming a peaked roof.

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
2)  SELECTING THE BLOCKS FROM THE DICTIONARY
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Below are the exact dictionary indices whose shape/color/orientation match each piece in the photo (no rotations allowed):

1. Bottom‐left red arch → Block #1  
2. Bottom‐right red arch → Block #2  
3. Center tall red arch (second layer) → Block #6  
4. Left rectangular red block (second layer) → Block #13  
5. Right rectangular red block (second layer) → Block #13  (same index reused)  
6. Long horizontal yellow block (third layer) → Block #7  
7. Left roof wedge (top layer) → Block #14  
8. Right roof wedge (top layer) → Block #15  

(Block #13 and Block #7 are each used twice and once respectively, but the same index applies.)

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
3)  STEP‐BY‐STEP ASSEMBLY INSTRUCTIONS
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
{
  Step1: Move block with index 1
  Step2: Move block with index 2
  Step3: Move block with index 13
  Step4: Move block with index 6
  Step5: Move block with index 13
  Step6: Move block with index 7
  Step7: Move block with index 14
  Step8: Move block with index 15
}

Following these eight moves will recreate the target structure exactly as shown in the photograph.
